result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen Dale Grant

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Allen Dale Grant. Defendant Allen Dale Grant not in court, in custody.  Attorney Ian F Vance-Curzan in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Allen Dale Grant not in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD. Case set for scheduling conference. Defense request an additional scheduling hearing. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status conference on August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Case assigned to Judge Brostrom, Branch 06 in error. Case has been reassigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br.15.

Defendant Allen Dale Grant in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Allen Dale Grant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective Rachel Smith   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04E (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.
  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Allen Dale Grant in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Allen Dale Grant in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Allen Dale Grant appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04B (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
